intro: Escobaria chaffeyi f. viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered liveforever, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, gray-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique foliage and color variations make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
